channel.title: An amendment to the forum rules: regarding buying/selling of RuneScape property
channel.description:
After a discussion among the staff members, we have agreed to hitherto disallow all price checking for anything related to RuneScape. There are possible legal implications behind allowing or even encouraging people to trade Jagex property (being, any sort of item or account of RuneScape). Nevertheless, that's not the only reason this rule has been changed.
There have been recent problems among some of our members who exchanged a RuneScape account. Based on the response Miss Silabsoft provided, we reiterated that we do not tolerate buying or selling anything on these forums. However, it's important to note this: we cannot stop any of you from buying or selling RuneScape items outside of this site, nor do we try to. Our rules try to protect the forum and the members of the forum. We don't impose this rule just to try and save the site's ass, but to prevent people from being scammed or dishonestly traded.
This rule exists solely for the purpose of stopping scamming via trading. This does only reflect RuneScape items, and nothing else. The original rule of no buying/selling of anything (with the old exception of SCAR scripts, which is no longer in effect), still remains. You can price check anything outside of RuneScape, if you so desire.
As an aside: unless we have substantial proof of scamming outside of the forum, we can do no action on the forum. Even with the necessary proof, it's up to the discretion of the moderator to actually act upon a request. We are not expected to ban people for things they do outside of the forum, but exceptions can be made in special circumstances.
This rule amendment is in effect as of February 10, 2012.
Thank you.

item.title: An amendment to the forum rules: regarding buying/selling of RuneScape property
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:24, topic:432464”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=535175.msg3959572#msg3959572 date=1333144591]
Get ready to see the good ol’ selling admin for RS Gold.
[/quote]That is

  1. so very very random
  2. old announcement is old[/quote]Lol, yea I haven’t been around very much lately…

Read full topic

item.title: An amendment to the forum rules: regarding buying/selling of RuneScape property
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:13, topic:432464”]I intentionally kept it open to interpretation, that’s why I also noted it’s up to the discretion of the moderator. Every situation has two sides, which is why discretion is so important. Just because one person has pictures, doesn’t mean the other one doesn’t. Just as much, one story may not compare with another story. I can’t definitively say what substantial proof is, because it’s dependent upon the context and on all parties involved.

Even in the court of law, you cannot convict someone of something simply because you heard one case. That would be absurd. Additionally, this is why laws are intentionally written to be vague and up to interpretation, where future precedents further narrow their definitions and, thereafter, applications in future conflicts. It comes down to how it should be interpreted and under what circumstances.[/quote]fair enough I will take rest of this to private message…just answer the messages please…

Read full topic
item.source: An amendment to the forum rules: regarding buying/selling of RuneScape property

item.title: An amendment to the forum rules: regarding buying/selling of RuneScape property
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I intentionally kept it open to interpretation, that’s why I also noted it’s up to the discretion of the moderator. Every situation has two sides, which is why discretion is so important. Just because one person has pictures, doesn’t mean the other one doesn’t. Just as much, one story may not compare with another story. I can’t definitively say what substantial proof is, because it’s dependent upon the context and on all parties involved.

Even in the court of law, you cannot convict someone of something simply because you heard one case. That would be absurd. Additionally, this is why laws are intentionally written to be vague and up to interpretation, where future precedents further narrow their definitions and, thereafter, applications in future conflicts. It comes down to how it should be interpreted and under what circumstances.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Loveandpower:

I already mentioned what proof we have. If images stating who is who and of transaction logs is not enough “substantial” proof then let me know what is.

[quote=“Taharok, post:1, topic:432464”]As an aside: unless we have substantial proof of scamming outside of the forum, we can do no action on the forum.

Thank you.[/quote]define substantial proof be specific.

Read full topic

item.title: An amendment to the forum rules: regarding buying/selling of RuneScape property
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

Davidi2:

Basically what this is saying, if you get scammed it’s your own fault for not taking our advice. Humans are humans, and lots of humans are greedy. Members of the forum are no exception, a lot of them will scam for profit. If you’re going to buy/sell, go through a proper median, and don’t come to us if it goes “pear shaped”.

David, puttin down the law since '08.

Read full topic

As an aside: unless we have substantial proof of scamming outside of the forum, we can do no action on the forum. Even with the necessary proof, it’s up to the discretion of the moderator to actually act upon a request. We are not expected to ban people for things they do outside of the forum, but exceptions can be made in special circumstances.
